Reviews.Title: TM717
Reviews.Author: Chris Pagoto
Reviews.Content: To address any prior review(s)....the SE TM717 is a dumb-phone, NOT a smartphone. Comparing this phone to a Blackberry, Android or iPhone isn't fair because it's not that type of phone. For one, you do NOT need an expensive data plan with this phone. The minimal $5-$10 data package that is available for these phones allows you email access, internet and possibly some text messaging allotment depending on your carrier.The good: GPS, 3.2mp camera, bluetooth, expandable memory slot, visual alert notifications, extremely thin design, lightweight, external display, RSS reader, (including podcasts) and 3G speeds. (Some of you may say "why not 4g?' to which I reply that there is no dumb-phone on the market that has any need for anything greater than 3G speeds.)The bad: T-Mobile has blocked out certain JAVA apps from executing and utilizing the network in order to function properly. Hence, when you download an app via the phone browser or one that you transfer on to the phone, there is a good chance it will not work. I'd say you have a 50-50 shot.What this phone is good for: People who are active and do not want a huge phone to shove in their pants pocket. This phone will slide into any shirt or pant pocket and nobody will ever know it's there. You can utilize Google Maps via the GPS and find your way to/from any two points with no problem. Need to take a quick picture?...no problem with the 3.2mp camera. For a flip phone the quality is above average, however compared to other 3.2mp camera phones available today the quality is average. If you need to listen to music/audio in the car you can use Bluetooth to sync up and play everything on your phone.Overall: It's a great phone at a great price that will satisfy anyone who is incredibly active and doesn't want to have to worry about big phones with big displays and big, costly data plans. This phone is great to grab, throw in your pocket, run out the door and not have to worry about anything else.

Reviews.Title: It's a good for ... for 2006
Reviews.Author: Carrot Juicelover
Reviews.Content: As of August 2011, this phone is still for $100 on Tmobile's website. I had the chance to use this phone since my own phone died.My Sony Ericson background: I use to have the sony walkman phone. That was THE BEST PHONE EVER. It was great, the software was nice, and everything worked well. The older walkman phone lines were amazing when they came out.Flash forward several years later.I have this in my hand. The phone looks great. When it rings it gives a nice effect of halos. The little digital display has a easily read time function.I love the fact it;'s a flip phone since I wont accidentally hit any keys.As soon as you activate it you know... its going to suck. BAD. This is pretty much the same software that I used years ago.. but SLOWER. seriously? slower? there is a slight delay navigating between menu items. Sony, you have had YEARS to update your interface. In the days of iphones and droids, charging good money for a phone with a bad interface doesn't cut the mustard.Another thing, to use head phones you need to use special dongle sony headphones. the phone doesnt have a headphone jack! or a usb port! You have to use their proprietary cabling. lose the cables? fork over another $40.For free this phone would be good,or $50 or less without contract , but when a droid can be had for $100, this phone wont do.

Reviews.Title: Excellent non-smartphone, but now too expensive!
Reviews.Author: Penina
Reviews.Content: See my review of the same phone, above, under Comments to Carrot Juice Lover; Sony-Ericsson and T-Mobile came up with a real winner on this one.Unfortunately, the price is now so high I had to lower my 5 stars to 4.  I'm still sticking with this one, though SE no longer makes it and so TM no longer carries.  This is probably why the price rocketed from 129 last year to 300!

Reviews.Title: Good phone. Bought to replace my old Sony Ericson.
Reviews.Author: V. Kulish
Reviews.Content: I like this little flip phone. It does what it for. I had Ericsin phone before and replace with the same phone again. I like it.

Reviews.Title: Phone simply died, others with same problem
Reviews.Author: A Hamilton "Lex"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these direct from TMobile. One is still working, not always very well.  The other started having charging issues just a few months after purchase, and bit the dust completely (screen went black, some things like the startup logo will come up, but nothing else) just out of the warranty period.  Similar problems reported on other review sites. Heads up: out of warranty they'll charge you $135 to repair it.  I'm taking the $135 and buying a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Defective product
Reviews.Author: Marco
Reviews.Content: I recieved my sony ericsson tm717 phone to find that only the apperance of the phone was correct . As far as it functioning it is defective .. When you open the phone the screen will not light up , in order to see the screen you have to open and close the phone several times in order for the screen to light up, and when it finally does only half of the screen is visable.. I want my money back!!!

Reviews.Title: OVERPRICED, OLD and BEAT UP
Reviews.Author: aaron
Reviews.Content: I gave it a 1 star because I paid $150 for an old, beat up, overpriced phone. I would not recommend anyone to buy from this user.

Reviews.Title: Sony rocks !
Reviews.Author: J. macarthur "cyberspacejunky"
Reviews.Content: I love this cell phone ; i buy this same phone every time i need a new cell phone .

Reviews.Title: As expected - satisfied
Reviews.Author: Dennis N.
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a cheap backup for my own Equinox.  Mine is beat up, and the seller said this one would be beat up too, so I knew this would not be a pretty phone.  It wasn't, and that's OK.  The phone seems to work fine, and it came with a charger so now I have a backup for my whole system for much less $$ than a new phone.It arrived very quickly - much quicker than I expected.  Very happy with the seller.

Reviews.Title: Sony Ericsson Equinox TM717 3g has something wrong with it!
Reviews.Author: Crystal Pollard
Reviews.Content: Something is wrong with my Sony Ericsson Equinox Tm717 cell phone.  Sometimes when I press the phone buttons to access information, it freezes up.  So far, eventually it will work...but I can't help thinking that I was duped.  Surely, the person who sent me a phone knew what was wrong, or didn't test it enough.

Reviews.Title: Nice on one hand but ..,
Reviews.Author: Curt
Reviews.Content: The cell phone is all that I'd  expected and it arrived in a timely fashion unlike the memory card to my dismay which was ordered at the same time !

Reviews.Title: Sony Ericsson
Reviews.Author: GARRY MARSDEN
Reviews.Content: The seals on the box were broken, no sim card, thankfully I had one from another phone. Otherwise I like this phone for what I use it for.

Reviews.Title: Great Cellphone
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best flip phones available. If you need something with great graphics, easy to use interface, and some really cool features, this is the phone for you.

Reviews.Title: Sony Ericsson Equinox
Reviews.Author: mlmagic
Reviews.Content: I must say, I LOVE this little phone. My last one died out and I wanted another one, so was lucky enough to find it here and new on amazon. For people like me, that just want to use a phone for what a phone is for, its perfect. It has lots of options, great texting, messaging, can get online when needed, camera, etc...but its still just a great everyday phone. I am not wanting to take on a smartphone yet, as my Mac does all that for me. So for now, this is great for another couple years I hope! As far as the peeling paint issues, my previous one did do that, so I just bought a skin for it and who would ever know. I still love the phone for its ease of use and very cool features it offers.

Reviews.Title: sony ericsson tm717
Reviews.Author: richl
Reviews.Content: This is my third Tm717 Sony Ericsson (they appeal to me, but, I have a problem with getting them wet). My issue with the last purchase was, I bought a "New" phone through Amazon. The phone looked good but the box and contents had obviously been disturbed. Since my history with Amazon was good I started using the phone, but soon discovered that the graphics on the outside of the flip lid were not working. This means you can not tell who is calling until you open the lid to answer. I also later realized that the ear piece was missing from the box. I have not bothered to return the phone, but I warn you to BE CAREFUL !!!Sony Ericsson Equinox Tm717 3g GPS RSS Reader Stereo Bluetooth T-mobile Cell Phone

Reviews.Title: Same Issues as Another Reviewer
Reviews.Author: LJG
Reviews.Content: Yes, let me back up Lex's review: I acquired two of these through T-Mobile as my father, who is a real techno-phobe, found them easy to use.  I encountered the same situation as Lex...charging issues.  I thought perhaps the battery went bad so I bought a new one cheaply here at amazon.  The phone recognized the full battery, but would not charge it.  It also would intermittently not recognize the SIM.  So the fault lay not with the battery but with the phone itself.I think the first phone lasted just shy of a year, and the other one lasted even less.  I'm very surprised by this bad quality as I really stick with phones for ages until they die...and in my case that means years!They both came to me free via contract incentives, which is why I'm not more bitter.I'm glad somebody else had this experience as I thought my dad simply man-handled them to death!This is a real shame as my dad really liked them and I'm on the hunt for a used one...I would prefer to move on though.

Reviews.Title: Can't last
Reviews.Author: Roshel
Reviews.Content: The thing is, this phone is actually pretty good, in terms of user friendliness and function. However, it has a LOT of serious flaws, and I know because i've had this exact same phone on THREE different occasions.Keep in mind that the first day i got this phone, it had a case, and i took relatively good care of it.2 months in: if you would drop the phone, it would restart and say "Inactive SIM," and would take a minute to restart3 months in: the paint started to chip4 months in: the vibration began working occasionally, and eventually it just never vibrated.4.5 months in: the battery life decreased DRAMATICALLY, it used to have 3 days of usage without a charger, and it went down to less than a full day.5 months in: the point of attachement between the phone and the keyboard was getting loose.5.5 months in: the phones speaker did not work, as in I physically could not make a call with it unless I was using a headset or speakerphone.6 months in: the overall speed of the phone went down to about 1/3 of what it was in the beginning, and to load any screen took much longer than in the beginning7 months in: the connection between the keyboard and the screen just broke, luckily the wires sustained it, so i had to tape it together.7.5 months in: the phone did not turn on. it was gone.The thing is, the phone itsself is not bad at all. its a very good phone, but it doesnt last long at all. I've had my ipod touch for about 3 years, and there are no problems with it, and I use it about as much as I use the phone, and it has survived longer without any problems than three of these phones. Unless you treat this phone like a piece of glass ready to shatter any second, i would not recommend this phone for anyone.

Reviews.Title: Peeling paint
Reviews.Author: Lowell
Reviews.Content: This is my wife's phone. We got it and the paint peeled after a few months. T-mobile would not replace it for peeling paint, but after a few more months it started having problems charging the battery, which T-mobile considered serious enough to justify a replacement. A few months later and the paint on the replacement phone is peeling. If you check the internet you will see that lots of other people have this same problem.This phone looks really AWFUL with peeling paint! In other respects this is an adequate phone. Not great, but adequate. But the paint issue -- it is like walking around in a shirt with a big stain on it. Peeling paint makes it look like the kind of phone a hobo would carry. Before you buy this, imagine that you are out in public with your friends and you have to pull out this raggedy looking phone.

Reviews.Title: that is woundful product....
Reviews.Author: nini-xia "hellen"
Reviews.Content: that is one of the woundful product....,thin body and unbelievable low price, the screen is very clear screen, also had angood radio communication....

Reviews.Title: Unuseable Phone
Reviews.Author: tman1955
Reviews.Content: The looks and design of phone appears fine if I was only able to use it. This is a T-Mobile phone and I am on the ATT plan and my sim card does not allow me to use or operate this phone. Thus, it is useless after repeated attempts to unlock it. Please email me return instructions. I had contacted the shipper and was told they were contacting Amazon to have these instructions emailed to me since they did not have the permission from you to do that.PLEASE REPLYterryecole@yahoo.com

ProductInfo.Features: Has 3G data, GPS navigation, memory card slot, RSS reader, аחԁ stereo Bluetooth.
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Ericsson Equinox Tm717 3g GPS RSS Reader Stereo Bluetooth T-mobile Cell Phone
